definition: see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]

sentences.english: Tom moved toward the strang sounds with his heart in his mouth .
sentences.chinese: 汤姆心惊胆颤地走近那奇怪的声音。

sentences.english: It was terrifying for us, as we were shaken by the waves.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪拍打在我们的身上，把我们吓得心惊胆颤。

sentences.english: The survivors lay on the beach, exhausted and shocked.
sentences.chinese: 幸存者躺在海岸上，疲惫不堪，心惊胆颤。

definition: lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
to be scared out of one's wits (idiom)
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
